Adding new glop to programming languages is easy.

Factoring so you don't need the glop is hard and gets harder with each new layer of glop that is added.
subs.rawText:
Adding new glop to programming languages is easy.

Factoring so you don't need the glop is hard and gets harder with each new layer of glop that is added.

subs.text: Maybe asking JavaScript to do everything you ever wanted to do with a language is the same mistake that was made turning XML-RPC into SOAP with all its WSDLness (and all the glop that followed WSDL).
subs.rawText: Maybe asking JavaScript to do everything you ever wanted to do with a language is the same mistake that was made turning XML-RPC into SOAP with all its WSDLness (and all the glop that followed WSDL).

subs.text: In fact the evolution of JS under the tutelage of Big Tech looks very much like a replay of SOAP to me.
subs.rawText: In fact the evolution of JS under the tutelage of Big Tech looks very much like a replay of SOAP to me.

subs.text:
I'd like to go the other way, see what we can live without and come up with a simple core that we use to get interop between codebases. 

In SOAP time we called that the BDG, or "Busy Developer's Guide" to whatever. In that case SOAP.

subs.rawText: It made it possible to deploy SOAP apps without waiting for the deliberations (and breakage) to complete.

subs.text:
The basic question to ask anyone who wants to provide a writing service for you is this:

Do I have to use your writing tool?

If the answer is no -- go right ahead, they're not locking you in.

If the answer is yes -- find a service that doesn't lock you in.
subs.rawText:
The basic question to ask anyone who wants to provide a writing service for you is this:

Do I have to use your writing tool?

If the answer is no -- go right ahead, they're not locking you in.

If the answer is yes -- find a service that doesn't lock you in.

subs.text: But be ready to pay money for the service that doesn't lock you in. No one is willing to host your stuff for free. If you aren't paying them in cash, you're paying them some other way.

subs.text: @jeffjarvis I took a political science in college, was thinking of being a major. When they got around to polling, what was made clear was you could get people to say whatever you want by how you asked the question.
subs.rawText: @jeffjarvis I took a political science in college, was thinking of being a major. When they got around to polling, what was made clear was you could get people to say whatever you want by how you asked the question.

subs.text:
@jeffjarvis For example if they asked this question.

1. Do you think Americans should support the president in times of war, regardless of party? 

And then..

2. Do you approve of how President Biden is handling the war in Ukraine?

You'd get the patriotic answer inside every American.
